name: OID assigned to the value set or code system
description: The OID assigned the same object as the URI points to. Examples include OIDs assigned to code systems like SNOMED CT (urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883..6.96) or LOINC (urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.6.1), value sets like AdministrativeGender (urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.11.1), identification systems like SSN (urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.4.1) etc.

element.short: OID assigned to the value set or code system
element.definition: The OID assigned the same object as the URI points to. Examples include OIDs assigned to code systems like SNOMED CT (urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883..6.96) or LOINC (urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.6.1), value sets like AdministrativeGender (urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.11.1), identification systems like SSN (urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.4.1) etc.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).
